intro: Poteranthera, commonly known as the fairy lantern, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Campanulaceae. It consists of several species, most notably Poteranthera glaberrima, which is native to the southeastern United States. The plant is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. Its foliage is typically gray-green and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Poteranthera thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or swampy habitats.
